actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-973, by Mr. Goss.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 4392 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 307.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 626.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 4392) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2001 for intelligence and intelligence-related activities of the United States Government, the Community Management Account, and the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against consideration of the conference report on H.R. 4392 (authorizing appropriations for intelligence and intelligence-related activities).

titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 4392) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2001 for intelligence and intelligence-related activities of the United States Government, the Community Management Account, and the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, and for other purposes.
